channel.title: Edgar Cayce
channel.description:
I've been watching the history channel lately.. they had some bullshit about the apocolypse this week so its neat.
some seer/guy who could see in the future from the late 1800s
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edgar_Cayce <interesting read
he started out by diagnosing himself in his sleep... then started diagnosing other people. People would sneak in questions about oil spots etc while he was asleep... http://www.edgarcayce.org/historychannel/cayce7prophecies.asp

item.title: Edgar Cayce
item.dc:creator: @ThatOneServer Mike_
item.description:
@ThatOneServer wrote:

He started off by diagnosing people in his own sleep. he would wake up with no recolection of what he said, and he cured a good handful of people who were gonna surely be dead.

He had an eighth grade education and no knowledge about medical shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Edgar Cayce
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I can’t prove he was a fake, so I won’t try.

But just my opinion on these channels, or any tv channel: I enjoy watching them, but never expect them to tell you the truth. They care about money, not about historical evidence. Plus the fact that they usually show you the story in such a way that it fits into the social expectations. Just to bring up one example: According to many historical shows I’ve seen, Hitler was nothing more then a crazy lunatic. Most people don’t expect a story about the great plans he and Albert Speer had.

Read full topic

item.title: Edgar Cayce
item.dc:creator: @Ske Ske
item.description:
@Ske wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

Most of these things are just like mediums: only the things they predict correctly get published. Ever seen a medium? They name the complete alphabet sometimes, but for some reason the person that gets a reading believes this bullshit so much they don’t notice that.

He did other things than predict the future.

Read full topic

item.title: Edgar Cayce
item.dc:creator: @Ske Ske
item.description:
@Ske wrote:

That was pretty interesting, especially because i believe some of the things he said and i haven’t ever read articles like that before.(except karma)

Still i dont entirely believe this because the skeptics have some good arguments too.(skeptics always ruin my fun)

Read full topic
